page.title: 01Wallington,Kirkharle,
page.content: Wallington is now the property of National Trust,bequeathed by late Sir Charles Trevelyan. Estate is extensive and includes good farmand,rough moorland and woodland. The Hall is mainly 18century - the central court being roofed in later on the advice of Ruskin. It has fine paintings and dplasterwork, with valuable art treasures. The stable building was originally intended as a chapel. There are attractive gardens with lakes and fine views to south over Shaftoe Crags. The wood prevent a view of Kirkharle where Capability Brown was born and served his apprenticeship. He was educated at Cambo and later helped to landscape the Wallington estates.Littleharle had a medieval tower to which later constructions were added. The dominating Victorian tower has been
